sect1.title: Overview of the bootstrap scripts
sect1.para: All commands from the ha-cluster-bootstrap package execute bootstrap scripts that require only a minimum of time and manual intervention.

listitem.para: With ha-cluster-geo-init, turn a cluster into the first member of a &geo; cluster. The script creates &booth.conf; (by taking several parameters like the names of the clusters, an arbitrator, and one or more tickets). It also configures the following cluster resources needed for booth:
A primitive resource for the booth daemon (ocf:pacemaker:booth-site). It communicates with the booth daemons on the other cluster sites.
A virtual IP address for each cluster site (ocf:heartbeat:IPaddr2). It is required by the booth daemon who needs a persistent IP address on each cluster site.
A cluster resource group (g-booth) for both primitives.
With ha-cluster-geo-join, add the current cluster to an existing &geo; cluster.
With ha-cluster-geo-init-arbitrator, make the current node an arbitrator for the &geo; cluster.

sect1.para: All bootstrap scripts log to /var/log/ha-cluster-bootstrap.log. Check this file for any details of the bootstrap process. Any options set during the bootstrap process can be modified later.
Each script comes with a man page covering the range of functions, the script's options, and an overview of the files the script can create and modify.
